caseTitle: Ikhlaq Ahmad v. Chief Secretary, Punjab, Lahore & others
tagline: The Punjab Civil Servants (Appointment and Conditions of Service) Rules, 1974 (“the Rules”) were made "in exercise of the powers conferred by section 23" of the Punjab Civil Servants Act, 1974 (“the Act”). However, section 23(1) of the Act restricts the making of such rules "for carrying out the purpose of this Act." The Act mentions the appointment, probation and confirmation of civil servants (sections 4, 5 and 6 respectively) but it does not stipulate, nor envisages, the contravention or abandonment of these provisions. Subordinate legislation cannot contravene the law, however, the manner in which rule 23 of the Rules was applied to induct the petitioners as regular civil servants did just that.
